posts.title: Stella Stellina
posts.caption:
Dalla collana "Piccole Rime" di Onde.

"Stella stellina, la notte s'avvicina..."

Una ninna nanna della tradizione italiana.

Animazione video by @grok

posts.title: Il Pulcino Bagnato
posts.caption:
Dalla collana "Piccole Rime" di Onde.

Un pulcino cerca riparo dalla pioggia sotto le ali della mamma chioccia.

Animazione by @grok

posts.title: Che Dice la Pioggerellina
posts.caption:
Dalla collana "Piccole Rime" di Onde.

"Che dice la pioggerellina di marzo, che picchia argentina sui tegoli vecchi del tetto..."

Poesia di Angiolo Silvio Novaro.
Animazione by @grok

posts.title: Giro di Vite
posts.caption:
Giro di vite, vita,
tiro di follia.
Trecentosessantacinque raggiri
intorno al sole,
dozzine di giramenti di testa,
miliardi i giri a vuoto
allato
al cuore.

posts.title: Loto
posts.caption:
Non estirpare il male dal tuo cuore.
Non cercare di spegnere il dolore.

Terra da coltivare.
Fango su cui fiorire.

posts.caption:

c'Ã¨ una sorgente di tempesta
c'Ã¨ il cosmo dissommerso

posts.title: Y Lan
posts.caption:
Ci separa la notte smisurata,
per unirci abbiamo solo i pensieri.
L'intera notte puÃ² essere colmata
dai sogni, finchÃ© li crediamo veri.

posts.title: Stelle
posts.caption:
ogni atomo, elemento
di cui Ã¨ composto il mondo
lo ha forgiato in un quanto
nello spazio profondo
una stella bruciando.

posts.title: Jacaranda
posts.caption:
Il vento mi attraversa, mi cancella.
Il mare Ã¨ la sua ancella
e l'anima ci sversa la sua scorza.

The wind flows through me. Erases me.
His maid is the sea
And the soul spills her skin.

posts.title: Volare
posts.caption:
sognare di volare
Ã¨ come liberare
un animale

posts.title: Terra e Stelle
posts.caption:
Dentro la terra
Verso le stelle
Tendiamo rami
Stendiamo mani

posts.title: PR Agent
posts.caption: Our PR agent posts automatically now. Sometimes automation is just teaching robots to do your job so you can do a better one.

posts.title: Kids QA
posts.caption: A 4-year-old tested our app and found 3 bugs I missed. Hiring kids as QA: unethical but effective.

posts.title: Code for Kids
posts.caption: Writing code for children means writing code your future self can understand. Turns out that's just... good code.

posts.title: Make It Squishy
posts.caption: Every recipe in our cooking game was tested by actual kids. Their feedback: 'Make it more squishy.' Working on it.

posts.title: Kids App Reality
posts.caption: Shipping a kids' app means parental controls, COPPA compliance, and testing on devices with sticky screens. The glamorous life.

posts.title: Design for Chaos
posts.caption: Kids don't read tutorials. They tap everything. Design for chaos, build for curiosity.

posts.title: Sound UX
posts.caption: Game dev for kids means every interaction needs sound feedback. Taps, swipes, success, failure. Audio is half the UX.

posts.title: 2 AM Tests
posts.caption: Our Unity test automation runs at 2 AM. I wake up to either green checkmarks or a to-do list. The machines never sleep.

posts.title: 3 AM Bug
posts.caption: Automated tests caught a bug at 3 AM that would have taken me hours to find. The robots are earning their keep.

posts.title: Factory Loop
posts.caption: The factory loop: build, test, fix, repeat. Let the machines do the boring parts while you sleep.

posts.title: Batch Mode
posts.caption: Unity batch mode is beautiful. Headless builds, automated tests, no mouse required. The CLI always wins.

posts.title: Telegram Bot
posts.caption: Set up a Telegram bot to post on X automatically. Now I'm teaching AI to do social media so I can do more coding.

posts.title: YAML Life
posts.caption: Today I wrote more YAML than C#. CI/CD pipelines are the code nobody talks about at conferences.

posts.title: Factory System
posts.caption: Added a factory automation system. Code builds overnight, tests run, Telegram pings me if something breaks. Sleep-driven development.

posts.title: LaunchAgents
posts.caption: LaunchAgents on macOS: cron jobs but fancier. The factory runs at 2 AM, the PR posts at 9:30 PM. Robots on schedule.

posts.title: Auto Commit Tweet
posts.caption: The PR agent now picks the most interesting commit of the day and tweets about it. Building in public, automated.

posts.title: VR Dizzy Test
posts.caption: VR development rule: if it makes you dizzy, it'll make your users sick. Testing on yourself is non-negotiable.

posts.title: Quest Dev Time
posts.caption: Meta Quest development: 80% waiting for builds, 15% fixing platform-specific bugs, 5% actual game code.

posts.title: VR Comfort
posts.caption: VR comfort settings are accessibility features. Motion sickness options aren't optional, they're mandatory.

posts.title: Quest 3 Passthrough
posts.caption: Quest 3 passthrough makes office simulation weird. Your real desk, virtual coworkers. The future of remote work nobody asked for.

posts.title: Ship It
posts.caption: The hardest part of game dev isn't the code. It's knowing when to stop adding features and ship something.

posts.title: Six Apps
posts.caption: Six apps in parallel, one developer. The secret? Shared architecture and a lot of copy-paste between projects.

posts.title: PDF Margins
posts.caption: Publishing a digital book is 10% writing, 90% figuring out why the PDF margins are wrong. Every. Single. Time.

posts.title: Unity 6
posts.caption: Unity 6 is fast. Like, noticeably fast. The editor doesn't freeze when I hit play anymore. Small wins.

posts.title: 23 Tests
posts.caption: The test framework wasn't installed. 23 tests, all failing because of one missing package. Unity dependency hell is real.

posts.title: KidsMusicStudio
posts.caption: Music creation app for kids: drag and drop instruments, make beats. Teaching composition without sheet music.

posts.title: BusinessIsBusiness
posts.caption: BusinessIsBusiness: a VR office simulator where you manage virtual employees. Yes, it's as meta as it sounds.

posts.title: KidsChefStudio
posts.caption: KidsChefStudio: 1035 lines of game code sat untouched for months. Today it finally runs. Sometimes you just need fresh eyes.

posts.title: XP Math
posts.caption: Fixed the XP system today. Cumulative thresholds, not incremental. Level 5 = 1000 XP total, not 1000 XP after level 4. Math matters.

posts.title: Chef Levels
posts.caption: Our cooking game has 8 chef levels. From Kitchen Helper to Master Chef. Gamification of Italian grandma's recipes.
